item.title: NHTSA 对近 100 万辆斯泰兰特道奇 SUV 进行工程分析
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五将其对近 100 万辆斯泰兰特道奇品牌汽车的调查从对门锁和车窗故障的初步评估升级为工程分析。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Friday upgraded its investigation into nearly 1 million Stellantis' Dodge brand vehicles to an engineering analysis from a preliminary evaluation over faulty door locks and windows.】

item.title: 亚马逊和英特尔业绩预测令人失望，期指下滑；就业数据令人期待
item.description: 在亚马逊和英特尔公司发布负面预测后，美国股指期货周五大幅下跌，投资者正在等待一份至关重要的就业报告，以进一步了解劳动力市场的线索，因为对经济放缓的担忧挥之不去。【原文：U.S. index futures fell sharply on Friday following downbeat forecasts from Amazon and Intel, with investors awaiting a crucial jobs report for further clues on the labor market amid lingering concerns over an economic slowdown.】

item.title: 亚马逊发出警告后，沃尔玛的低价承诺成为焦点
item.description: 沃尔玛的 "天天低价 "承诺将在其季度业绩报告中接受考验。此前，竞争对手亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）警告称，顾客已经变成了讨价还价的猎手，迫使这家网上购物巨头预测本季度业绩疲软。【原文：Walmart's "Everyday Low Price" promise will be put to the test when it reports quarterly results, after rival Amazon.com's warning that customers had turned bargain hunters, pressuring the online shopping behemoth to forecast a weak current quarter.】

item.title: 特斯拉 7 月在华电动车销量同比增长 15.3
item.description: 中国乘用车联席会（CPCA）周五公布的数据显示，7月份美国汽车制造商特斯拉在中国生产的电动汽车销量同比增长15.3%，达到74,117辆。【原文：U.S. automaker Tesla's sales of China-made electric vehicles rose 15.3% from a year earlier to 74,117 units in July, data from the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) showed on Friday.】

item.title: 英特尔扭亏为盈，股价将创 24 年来最大跌幅
item.description: 英特尔暂停派息并裁员，以资助其芯片制造业务进行代价高昂的扭亏为盈，这将是该公司自 2000 年以来最严重的一次抛售，周五英特尔的市值将被抹去近 250 亿美元。【原文：Intel was set to erase nearly $25 billion in market value on Friday in what would be its worst selloff since 2000 after it suspended its dividend and slashed its workforce to fund a costly turnaround for its chip-making business.】

item.title: 全国企业数据库显示，特斯拉在中国注册了保险经纪公司
item.description: 根据国家企业信息数据库，特斯拉于 7 月底在中国注册了一家保险经纪公司，这表明这家美国汽车制造商可能正在再次尝试获得在中国销售保险产品的批准。【原文：Tesla registered an insurance broking firm in China at the end of July, based on a national corporate information database, in a sign that the U.S. automaker may be trying again to gain approval to sell insurance products in the country.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车公司七月份销量增长 6
item.description: 总部位于瑞典的沃尔沃汽车公司周五表示，受欧洲全电动汽车销量增长的推动，该公司 7 月份的汽车销量同比增长 6%，达到 57,447 辆。【原文：Volvo Cars' sales rose 6% year-on-year in July to 57,447 cars, driven by an increase in fully electric vehicles in Europe, the Sweden-based automaker said on Friday.】

item.title: 印尼财政部预计第二季度国内生产总值增长 5%，并强调地缘政治风险
item.description: 印尼财政部长周五表示，印尼第二季度经济增长可能略微放缓至5%，当局正在关注可能影响国内经济的地缘政治发展。【原文：Indonesia's economic growth probably slowed slightly to 5% in the second quarter and authorities are monitoring geopolitical developments that could affect the domestic economy, its finance minister said on Friday.】

item.title: 媒体报道美国调查后，英伟达股价在法兰克福下跌 2
item.description: 据媒体报道，在接到竞争对手芯片制造商的投诉后，美国政府将对英伟达展开反垄断调查，与此同时，科技股也出现了大面积抛售，英伟达股价周五在法兰克福下跌了 2.3%。【原文：Nvidia shares fell 2.3% in Frankfurt on Friday, following media reports of the U.S. government launching an antitrust probe into the company following complaints from rival chipmakers, and alongside a broad sell off in tech stocks.】

item.title: 亚马逊股价在法兰克福暴跌近 8
item.description: 亚马逊周五在法兰克福早盘交易中股价下跌近8%，此前亚马逊公布第二季度在线销售增长放缓，并指出消费者正在寻找更便宜的购物选择。【原文：Amazon shares fell almost 8% in early trading in Frankfurt on Friday after reporting slowing online sales growth in the second quarter and noting consumers were seeking out cheaper options for purchases.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，奥迪全新中国电动车系列将不会采用标志性的四环标志
item.description: 两位直接了解该计划的人士表示，奥迪在中国为中国市场开发的新电动汽车系列将不会使用其四环标志。【原文：Audi's new electric cars series developed in China for the Chinese market will not sport its four-ring logo, two people with direct knowledge of the plans said.】

item.title: 中国央行顾问呼吁加大刺激力度，实现通胀目标
item.description: 一位央行政策顾问在上周五的讲话中表示，中国应加大财政刺激力度以刺激经济增长，并设定一个坚定的通胀目标，以防止中国陷入 "低通胀陷阱"。【原文：China should ramp up its fiscal stimulus to spur economic growth and set a firm inflation target to prevent the country falling into a "low inflation trap", a central bank policy adviser said in remarks seen on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 日益加剧的经济忧虑威胁美股涨势
item.description: 经济忧虑再次出现在华尔街的雷达上，因为人们越来越担心，数月来的高利率可能开始损害美国的经济增长。【原文：Economic concerns are once again showing up on Wall Street's radar, as worries grow that months of elevated interest rates may be starting to hurt U.S. growth.】

item.title: 早间竞标对经济增长的新担忧令市场恐慌
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 预计七月份美国就业增长缓慢而稳定
item.description: 7 月份，美国就业人数可能会以缓慢但仍然健康的速度增长，这可能有助于减轻人们对劳动力市场迅速恶化的担忧，6 月份失业率升至 4.1%，创下两年半以来的新高，从而加剧了这种担忧。【原文：U.S. employment likely increased at a slow, but still healthy pace in July, which could help to allay fears of a rapid labor market deterioration that had been stoked by a rise in the unemployment rate to a 2-1/2-year high of 4.1% in June.】

item.title: 中国经济复苏乏力，全球企业增长前景黯淡
item.description: 从全球连锁汉堡店到汽车制造商，都日益感受到世界第二大经济体中国经济复苏乏力带来的压力，并开始为未来的颠簸之旅做好准备。【原文：Global burger chains to car manufacturers are increasingly feeling the pinch from a faltering recovery in the world's No. 2 economy, China, and are strapping in for a bumpy ride ahead.】

item.title: 美国经济增长担忧加剧，澳元和新西兰元面临避险情绪的冲击
item.description: The Australian dollar was pinned near three-month lows on Friday as weak U.S. data fuelled fears of a sharp slowdown in the world's largest economy, sending investors to the embrace of the safe-haven yen and Swiss franc.

item.title: 日本第二季度经济可能因消费回升而反弹：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，得益于工厂产出和消费的回升，日本经济在经历了上一季度的萎缩后，很可能在4-6月份出现反弹，这有助于央行为进一步加息提供依据。【原文：Japan's economy likely rebounded in the April-June period after shrinking in the previous quarter thanks to a pick-up in factory output and consumption, a Reuters poll showed, helping the central bank make the case for further interest rate hikes.】

item.title: 巴菲特抛售更多美国银行股票，销售额高达 38 亿美元
item.description: 亿万富翁沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）经营的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）扩大了对美国银行股票的抛售，自 7 月中旬以来已抛售了这家美国第二大银行超过 38 亿美元的股票。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway , run by billionaire Warren Buffett, extended its selling of Bank of America shares, and has shed more than $3.8 billion of the second-largest U.S. bank's stock since mid-July.】

item.title: 菲律宾 Mynt 公司获得阿亚拉和 MUFG 融资，估值增至 50 亿美元
item.description: 周五，菲律宾电子钱包品牌Mynt公司和希望首次公开募股的GCash公司分别发表声明称，在获得阿亚拉公司（Ayala Corp）和日本三菱日联金融公司（Mitsubishi UFJ Financial）的投资后，Mynt公司的估值翻了一番多，达到50亿美元。【原文：Mynt, which operates the Philippine e-wallet brand and IPO-hopeful GCash, has more than doubled its valuation to $5 billion following investments from Ayala Corp and Japan's Mitsubishi UFJ Financial, the companies said in separate statements on Friday.】

item.title: 美国就业数据备受关注，股市因经济增长担忧而下跌
item.description: 周五，在美国工厂数据弱于预期引发对经济前景恶化的担忧之后，亚洲股市和美国国债收益率下滑，而瑞士法郎和日元则因安全买盘而上涨。【原文：Asian shares and U.S. Treasury yields slid while the Swiss franc and Japanese yen rose on safety bids on Friday after weaker-than-expected U.S. factory data sparked fears of a worsening economic outlook.】

item.title: 日本在政府白皮书中警告日元疲软对家庭的影响
item.description: 日本政府周五在一份报告中称，日元疲软正在伤害日本家庭的情绪，并可能削弱他们的购买力，这凸显了政府对日元下跌对经济造成负面影响的担忧。【原文：A weak yen is hurting Japanese households' sentiment and could erode their purchasing power, the government said in a report on Friday, underscoring its concern over the negative economic impact of the currency's fall.】

item.title: 需求担忧打压市场情绪，石油将连续第四周下跌
item.description: 由于全球燃料需求增长令人失望的迹象超过了对主要中东产区供应中断的担忧，周五油价有所上涨，但仍将连续第四个星期下跌。【原文：Oil prices rose on Friday but were set for a fourth weekly decline as signs of disappointing global fuel demand growth outweighed fears of supply disruptions in the key Middle East production region.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，Nvidia 因竞争对手投诉面临美国司法部调查
item.description: 据 The Information 周四报道，美国司法部的反垄断官员正在调查有关 Nvidia 公司涉嫌滥用其市场支配地位销售人工智能芯片的投诉。【原文：Antitrust officials at the U.S. Department of Justice are investigating complaints over Nvidia allegedly abusing its market dominance in selling chips that power artificial intelligence, The Information reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国经济放缓担忧升温，避险日元和瑞士法郎飙升
item.description: 周五，避险货币日元和瑞士法郎兑美元汇率接近数月高点，此前美国制造业意外下滑加剧了市场对经济下滑的担忧，导致股市和债券收益率暴跌。【原文：The safe-haven Japanese yen and Swiss franc traded near multi-month highs against the dollar on Friday after an unexpected slump in U.S. manufacturing fuelled fears of a downturn, sending stocks and bond yields tumbling.】

item.title: 特斯拉遭在自动驾驶车祸中丧生的摩托车手家属起诉
item.description: 2022 年，在犹他州发生了一起特斯拉 Model 3 自动驾驶汽车撞人事故，一名摩托车手在事故中丧生，他的父母起诉了这家电动汽车制造商和汽车驾驶员，声称驾驶员辅助软件和其他安全功能 "存在缺陷和不足"。【原文：The parents of a motorcyclist who was killed in a 2022 crash involving a Tesla Model 3 on Autopilot in Utah sued the electric carmaker and the vehicle's driver, claiming that the driver assistant software and other safety features are "defective and inadequate."】

item.title: 美国法官驳回 "周日门票 "诉讼案中对 NFL 做出的 47 亿美元判决
item.description: 美国加利福尼亚州的一名法官周四撤销了对美国橄榄球联盟（National Football League）的一项 47 亿美元的判决，该联盟在一项诉讼中声称其在十多年的时间里向周日票（Sunday Ticket）比赛转播的用户多收费用。【原文：A U.S. judge in California on Thursday threw out a $4.7 billion verdict against the National Football League in a lawsuit claiming it overcharged subscribers to its Sunday Ticket game telecasts for more than a decade.】

item.title: 新加坡华侨银行第二季度净利润增长 14%，超出预期
item.description: 新加坡第二大银行华侨银行（OCBC）周五公布，第二季度净利润同比增长 14%，主要是受收入增长和津贴下降的推动。【原文：Singapore's second-largest bank Oversea-Chinese Banking Corp (OCBC) reported on Friday a 14% jump in net profit in the second quarter from a year earlier, driven mainly by income growth and a decline in allowances.】

item.title: 韩国通胀率在连续三个月疲软后于 7 月份回升
item.description: 周五的官方数据显示，在连续三个月疲软之后，韩国的消费通胀率在供应方压力的作用下于7月份略有上升，略高于市场预期。【原文：South Korea's consumer inflation ticked up in July on supply-side pressures after weakening for three straight months, official data showed on Friday, coming in slightly higher than market expectations.】

item.title: 长期而言，中国需要的不仅仅是 "渐进式 "消费刺激政策
item.description: 中国为刺激家庭支出所做的努力有望帮助经济实现政府制定的 2024 年约 5%的增长目标，但从明年起，政府可能必须为消费者做更多工作，否则就得接受增长放缓的现实。【原文：China's efforts to boost household spending are expected to help the economy hit the government's 2024 growth target of roughly 5%, but the authorities may have to do more for consumers from next year or accept slower growth.】
